params.description: This plan has zero expenses, roi, cola, and income taxes to make it easy to focus on just the gift tax results. Both of Bush's tax relief acts are rescinded to show worst case gift taxes.
params.title: Example using a joint account to pay premiums to a Crummey insurance trust. The insurance beneficiaries are both considered to be the gift receipients. The joint account owners split the premium gift payments to minimize gift taxes. Both of Bush's tax relief acts are rescinded to show worst case gift taxes.

account.description: Liquid assets of the Smiths, used to fund the premiums for the 2nd-To-Die insurance
account.title: Discount Brokerage

transfer.description: This pays the insurance premium and is liable for gift taxes, which are allocated between the joint account owners. The amount withdrawn is calculated so that the after-tax net covers the 30,000 premium.

insurance.description: Creates an inheritance for the children
insurance.title: 2nd-To-Die Insurance

beneficiary.description: First beneficiary gets 70% of the total payout

account.description: This account funds retirement after other account is depleted.  Balance amounts over the basis value are assumed to be long term gains. Withdrawals are taxed at long term rates until basis is reached.

transfer.description: This transfer is executed when the account balance is below the original cost basis balance, hence is not taxed, except for the portion that is the appreciation of the capital gain account for the year.

params.title: Plan Details

Bob converts his IRA to a Roth IRA and pays the withdrawal tax from a tax normal account. Run this plan, and then run the "ira not converted to roth ira example" file for a comparison of the final results. This Roth conversion is better.

account.description: Used to pay tax due on IRA withdrawal for Roth conversion rollover
account.title: Savings Account

deposit.description: A 4,000 maximum contribution is allowed for years 2005-2007.
A 5,000 maximum contribution is allowed starting in 2008.

name: Ira not converted to roth ira

params.title: Bob does not convert his IRA to a Roth IRA. Run this plan, and then run the "ira conversion to roth ira example" file for a comparison of the final results. The Roth conversion is better.

account.description: Used to pay tax due on IRA withdrawal for Roth conversion rollover
account.title: Savings Account

deposit.description: A 4,000 maximum contribution is allowed for years 2005-2007.

name: Yearly ira distributions for insurance - one principal

params.description: Zero expenses, roi, cola to focus just on withdrawal and gift tax results. Tax rate of 20% applies to IRA withdrawals. The Bush tax laws are resinded at their sunset years to show worst case gift taxes.
params.title: Simple example of IRA distributions as gifts for life insurance premiums via transfer instructions. Both of Bush's tax relief acts are rescinded to show gift taxes. IRA withdrawal tax and gift taxes are calculated assuming a Crummey trust arrangement. The premium payment is treated as a gift divided between the policy beneficiaries, according to their benefit ratio. The total withdrawal is adjusted so that the net after all taxes is the needed transfer to pay the premium.

account.description: This receives surplus of the IRA withdrawals mandated by minimum required distributions after age 70 1/2.
account.title: Husband Savings Account

ira.description: This IRA account is used to show how all withdrawal and gift taxes are calculated to result in a withdrawal with a net amount that pays the insurance premium.
ira.title: Husband IRA Account

transfer.description: Withdraw enough to pay all taxes and still deliver enough to cover insurance premium

insurance.description: Assumed to be held by a Crummey trust, identified as Third Party owner. Large premium is to demonstrate gift allocation and tax calculations dependant upon beneficiary's share. This does not reflect real world policies.
insurance.title: Life Insurance Policy

beneficiary.description: Second beneficiary gets all remaining benefit, which is 30% of total.
Gift allocation for tax calculation is based on beneficiary's share. First beneficiary gets 70%, so 70% of the premium is allocated as a gift to that person.

params.description: Initial financial situation
params.title: Staged rollover Roth conversions over 8 years produce a large change in net worth.

transfer.description: Two years of rollover conversions of amount fitting in the 28% bracket
Two years of rollover conversions of amount filling up the 33% bracket
Final year of rollover conversions with residual amount filling up the 28% bracket
Four more years of rollover conversions continuing to fill up the 28% bracket
Five more years of rollover conversions continuing to fill up the 33% bracket. First year fills in Harry's last year.
Final year of rollover conversions with residual amount filling up the 28% bracket
